body:
> See https://www.yiiframework.com/doc/guide/2.0/en/runtime-requests#trusted-proxies

I know that, but it does not help as `Forwarded` header is not simply, Hey it is HTTPS or however `$secureProtocolHEaders`, `$ipHeaders` works.. it is encoded string that is strictly defined in standard..

Good thing about standards is that people slowly start using them and they are enforced and well(but quite technically) documented. AND you really cannot argue with them.

`X-*` headers are not standard
That is definitely something we want in Yii 3. Not sure it could be considered a bug not supporting it...

> That is definitely something we want in Yii 3. Not sure it could be considered a bug not supporting it...

what if I told you that I am already trying to implement it

issue.title: Network resolver instead of operate with REMOTE ADDR and more

body:
> @mikk150 for Yii 3?

No, for Yii2, but it can be copied to that middleware
OK. If there will be no BC breaks then we'd consider it for Yii 2 as well.
